metadata.title: CVE-2022-31813 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 and earlier may not send the X-Forwarded-*headers to the origin server based on client side Connection headerhop-by-hop mechanism. This may be used to bypass IP based authentication onthe origin server/application.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31813` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm8
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm8
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm8
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm8
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm8
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm8
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm8
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm8
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm8
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm8
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm8
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm8
libapache2-mod-macro - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm8
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm8
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm8').
